name: Jesduvroq

adverseReactions: jesduvroq contraindicated patients : •receiving strong cyp2c8 inhibitor gemfibrozil [ ( 7.1 ) , pharmacology ( 12.3 ) ] . •with uncontrolled hypertension [ ( 5.3 ) ] .
indications_original:
JESDUVROQ is indicated for the treatment of anemia due to chronic kidney disease (CKD) in adults who have been receiving dialysis for at least four months.
                  
                     Limitations of Use
                  
                  JESDUVROQ has not been shown to improve quality of life, fatigue, or patient well-being.
                  JESDUVROQ is not indicated for use:
                  
                     
                        •As a substitute for red blood cell transfusions in patients who require immediate correction of anemia.
                     
                        •For treatment of anemia of chronic kidney disease in patients who are not on dialysis.
contraindications_original: • Administer orally once daily, with or without food. ( 2.2 , 2.3 ) • See Full Prescribing Information for starting dosage based on hemoglobin level, liver function and concomitant medications, and for dose titration and monitoring recommendations. ( 2.3 , 2.4 , 2.5 , 2.6 )
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
How Supplied
                  
                  JESDUVROQ tablets contain 1 mg, 2 mg, 4 mg, 6 mg or 8 mg of daprodustat.

                     Storage and Handling
                  
                  Store at 20°C to 25°C (68°F to 77°F); excursions permitted between 15°C and 30°C (59°F to 86°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature].
adverseReactions_original:
JESDUVROQ is contraindicated in patients:
                  
                     
                        •Receiving a strong CYP2C8 inhibitor such as gemfibrozil [see Drug Interactions (7.1), Clinical Pharmacology (12.3)].
                     
                        •With uncontrolled hypertension [see Warnings and Precautions (5.3)].
